p: EV-A71 infection with neurological complications and mortality was observed in Sarawak in April 1997, followed by reports in Peninsular Malaysia [ 57, 58]. According to the Sarawak State Department of Health, there were 2628 HFMD cases, including 29 deaths due to encephalitis and cardiac failure (Fig.Â 1) [ 59]. During this period, such encephalomyelitis associated with neurogenic pulmonary edema caused by EV-A71 infection in Kuala Lumpur were implicated in four fatal cases [ 60, 61]. Concurrent with adenovirus, EV-A71 involvement resulted in myocardial failure and death during the HFMD outbreak in Sibu, Sarawak [ 62].
